com.foreach.across.modules.dynamicforms.domain.document.data

Interface DynamicDocumentFieldAccessor<T>


  • public interface DynamicDocumentFieldAccessor<T>
    Single field accessor, wraps a DynamicDocumentFieldDefinition together with a data accessor for retrieving the actual value, setting or deleting it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object delete()
      Delete the field (if possible).
      boolean exists()
      Does the actual field already exist? It's possible that the field has a null value set, but this will return false if for example a parent field does not yet exist.
      T get()
      Get the field value, don't create the default if the field does not yet exist.
      DynamicDocumentFieldDefinition getFieldDefinition() 
      org.springframework.core.convert.TypeDescriptor getFieldType() 
      T getOrCreate()
      Get the field value and if the field does not yet exist, create and set the default value.
      Object set(Object value)
      Set the field value.

    • Method Detail

      • getFieldDefinition

        DynamicDocumentFieldDefinition getFieldDefinition()
        Returns:
        the full field definition for this field

      • getFieldType

        org.springframework.core.convert.TypeDescriptor getFieldType()
        Returns:
        the field type descriptor, only values matching the given type will be accepted by set(Object)

      • set

        Object set(Object value)
        Set the field value. Return any previously set value.

      • get

        T get()
        Get the field value, don't create the default if the field does not yet exist.

      • getOrCreate

        T getOrCreate()
        Get the field value and if the field does not yet exist, create and set the default value. Mainly used for intermediate paths.

      • delete

        Object delete()
        Delete the field (if possible). Return the deleted value.

      • exists

        boolean exists()
        Does the actual field already exist? It's possible that the field has a null value set, but this will return false if for example a parent field does not yet exist.

        Note that if there is no field definition, an accessor will never be created. So this method can be used to check if a field instance exists, but you can always be sure the field instance is creatable if it does not exist yet.
